title: Hope someone can help.......I have a T206
author: philliesfan

posts.post_title: Hope someone can help.......I have a T206
posts.post_content:
I have a T206 Rube Marquard card autographed and certified by PSA.  I never intended to sell this but I have an offer I am thinking about.  Does anyone know what this may be worth?  The PSA web site shows 3 have been authenticated.  Any help is appreciated.
Thank you,
Bob

are probably the most common autographed T206.  That means they have changed hands several times.  There are a few folks on here who have bought them that may can help.  Which pose is it (not sure that matters)?

Yep, a good person to contact would be T206Collector on this forum (he has been known to collect the occasional signed T206 ;)  ).  You might try sending him a personal message (PM).  Good luck with the sale, Bob, and feel free to post a scan if you have one (we always like looking at cards :)  ).

Bob,

Nice card.  Since Marquard died in 1980 (age 93) he was one of the last T206 guys around and therefore he's one of the most common to find with an autograph.  

However, he is a HOFer and any signed T206 is a mini treasure.  I would guess it's worth 350 -500 certainly somewhere near that ballpark.

Best,
Scott
